reviews.review:
So I went to TC's on the reviews of my fellow Yelpers and because it's about 2 blocks from where I live. I walk in and it was your atypical mom-n-pop rib shop which I get very excited about. We got the menus and they have a lot of items but they're pricey. I'm thinking they better be good for this price. When the baby back  ribs came they basically tasted the same as Chilis (which I like but expected something different). They had a lot of fat on them and seemed to be a big part of the ribs. The fried okra was the best part of the meal, very big and well made.  Another thing that bugged me were the drinks. I ordered water and it came in this little rinky dinky small cup, maybe 8 oz. My friend orders a soda and they bring her a big 16 oz cup that just towers over mine. So at this point I was feeling it to be an average 3-star place. Decent but nothing unique but before we were to leave my friend reminded of the big reason I wanted to come...bread pudding! Quickly I ordered it up. I was excited, I love bread pudding and take respect at how hard it can be to make it let alone to make it right. Not many places have this delicacy so I jump at the chance to get some when the opportunity arises. Then it comes...the disappointment that made this a 1-star restaurant. First off let me say this bread pudding is not cheap. $6. I'm willing to pay that though for some good bread pudding. This was not it. As the waitress is handing me my dessert I'm asking how they make it. With raisins? Bourbon? What's their unique, creative touch on it? 'Krispy Kreme', she says. Say wha??? 'Its really just a 'Krispy Kreme donut that we heat up', she continues. I don't know if I've ever felt so betrayed from a restaurant. I just paid 6 freakin dollars for a donut???  
All in this place, less the okra, was am utter disappointment.  And if you decide on dessert, ask how it's made. Shame on you TC's.

Food was great however the service was horrible. Took a good 10-15 mins for somebody to come take our drink order. Once we did get our food nobody bothered to come see if we needed a refill. Next time I'll just order for take out.
Pretty good barbeque for take out. I would only use it with a coupon offer though. Which they have a lot of! The greens are excellent.

Daaaaaaaaaaang. Those ribs though. 

Got the three meat combo with two sides for a whopping $10 to share. Waaaaaaaaah???? Thanks to the yelp $10 for $20 deal I gots my belly full for a good Denny's price dealio with some real legit food. 

Pulled pork was soft and juicy. Brisket was good...not the best. Beef ribs were soooooooo yummy, fatty, and falling off the bone. It was sheer beauty. 

Mac and cheese side was meh for me. The baked beans were good, but I ain't no baked beans connoisseur. 

One sucky thing is you can only use one yelp coupon per table. I don't get it...so if we were sitting separately we could have used two coupons we had specifically bought prior to entering. 

Whatever, it's a common rule so I shouldn't complain but my eyes were bigger than my stomach in the beginning so I was dead set on using two coupons to get $40 worth of food. This gigantic plate was enough to feed two. Oh and it came with corn bread, soooooooon! I've had better, so didn't finish mine. 

I'll be back for a full plate of beef ribs only with some fried sides next time!!!

I grabbed the Yelp deal as many others did! My brothers and I ordered the Chicken and Waffles with Muddy Water! Totally delicious! Service was awesome and the wait for food wasn't extremely long, either. A very pretty lady(assuming is the owner or some sort) came to our table and asked if we enjoyed our meal and gave us a free banana pudding! So nice! It's less than 5 mins away from my house so I will most definitely be back again! Especially to try their weekly specials!

I hate to give 2 star reviews, but there were too many things wrong with the food.  I'll start with the good.  The mac and cheese was excellent!  The Greens were also good.  The rib tips were hit and miss.  Most of them were pretty fatty and dry, some were good, but those were the minority.  The brisket was hit and miss too, but mostly miss.  The first few pieces were good, the middle was a mixed bag of okay and dry, the bottom had a chunk of brisket that was hard and in a huge clump, not appetizing and disgusting.  Even the good parts, wasn't that good.

The service was fine and the inside wasn't bad for a casual place.

The cornbread was dry, like dry dry.  The honey they had was not pure honey, it was a honey mix of corn syrup and honey.

I wanted to like this place and to give it a shot and half way through the meal I was at 3 stars, but it got down to 2 stars by the end of the meal.

I won't be going back.  You can give them a try and judge for yourself like I did, but there are much better bbq options in Las Vegas.
Typical Barbecue place, nothing special... sides are not appealing in my opinion. Long wait.

Made the mistake of purchasing too many yelp deals.

When some place claims to be a BBQ restaurant, smokiness and BBQ is the first thing you should smell. That was the first red flag. Secondly, we ordered barbecue wings and were served regular wings with barbecue sauce on it. Third most terrible thing was the catfish. The fish fillets were identical in shape and size, I could immediately tell it was from the freezer! The blan fish lacked simple seasons like salt and pepper, to say the least.

This is not soul nor quality food.

There's a reason for the Yelp deal here.

This is my new fav place for BBQ!! 

I was in the mood for bbq ribs and we were about to head out to the new place in Downtown Summerlin, however the reviews were not too great and overpriced. Then we found this place and decided to give it a shot. Best decision ever!! I'm picky with my BBQ and this place hit the spot! The staff was friendly and very welcoming- food was awesome and you could tell everything is made from scratch! Will definitely be back!! Highly recommended!

I was feeling the mood too try something new in my area of town. I know this place has won best of las vegas review journal awards although that was few years back. Since then the competition comes too barbeque has stepped up with new places on top of the established ones. So some ways going in it was going too be tough too stand out. I always always give any place benefit of open mind and like try new places get my own take on it. Really TC's Rib Crib never had any WOW factor too the food I tasted. It was average barbeque at best with average sides. Really even though this location is on my side of town would much rather drive farther too get more authentic barbeque on.

I ended up ordering the pulled pork (I always fail too get it sandwich style or forget) with choice of two sides and comes with cornbread. I settled on fried okra and mac/cheese for my sides. The amount of pulled pork they give you actually decent size for the price you pay. I wished it covered in more sauce. They ask you when food comes out if want more barbeque sauce. I did. The tables can dine inside none of them automatically have barbeque sauce as set condiments. I found odd considering it is barbeque joint? I not much fan of the barbeque sauce felt like it lacked depth, rather bland, and nice if had few options too choose from. The sides I did enjoy the fried okra!!!! Really just diced okra battered and fried. It nice golden brown, crispy on the outside, and nice hot and moist on the inside. The mac and cheese wished could have been more creamy and cheesy. It was ok. The cornbread was pretty good. Maybe I needed too the order the ribs but suppose save that for another visit...Maybe.

The service was good. They asked if wanted too dine in or take out. The gentlemen asked if wanted more barbeque sauce. Attentive. They have really cheap lunch special and great groupon deal going right now. It small place so can fill up fast if it gets busy. I went during weekday for dinner so only one in the restaurant.

Before the move to this location, my last visit was rather disappointing, so when my husband wanted to go here for dinner tonight, I was a little hesitant.  

The place was near empty, it's a lot bigger dinner room and the service was good.  I go a two meat combo, sausage and brisket with two sides.  I loved the sausage, but the brisket I didn't care for.  I think it's more like roast beef, cut into thin strips, there is no smoke line, and it reminds me a lot of my mothers Sunday roast beef.  

My husband got a slab of ribs and they were very good, so if I come back, I will skip the brisket.

Nice homey place in a strip mall near the Lakes. I had the 2 meat special (ribs and pulled pork) with greens and the mac n cheese. The food was good and filling. The mac n cheese was a little oily (I guess the cheese was separating). A decent place worth trying again.

I tried out TC's because Buzz BBQ near my house closed.  It was worth the drive.  The chicken was near perfect and the mac and cheese is as great as others say.  Cole slaw was not my favorite but if you really cole slaw you will probably like theirs.  I will definitely try it again.
The food was good. It was a little pricey though. The employees were very friendly and the the place was nice and clean. It was a little cold inside though.

Very disappointed, place didn't smell right when we came in, maybe dirty mop water, also the paper and plastic ware was a set back, ordered the chicken and waffles,  chicken very good, waffles was so so, brought a friend with me and had to apologies to her for bringing her. Won't be back.
Decent prices , very friendly staff , but most importantly great food. The yelp deal also a steal.

I love it here! Right down the street from my house and it's culture rich. I can dig it. The sweet tea was amazing. I had rib tips and chicken which were both good. I admit the tips were a little dry. But overall still good the ribs however I was definitely impressed with we got half and half rack of ribs and it was super good. Definitely on my bucket list to come back :-)

I reserved a table for 20 people for a birthday dinner and TC's Rib Crib set it up on time and were great meeting the demands of our larger group. It's a lovely mom n pop business. The food was delicious including the BBQ chicken! I would recommend the family platter for a group of 4!! You get 4 meats, 3 sides, fries and cornbread. Plenty!!!

CONS:
-I would only return using the $10 for $20 YELP deal
-they were out of rib tips AND brisket!
-plastic utensils. I would have expected at least real serrated knives for cutting the meat

Eh....i wasn't impressed. I got the beef ribs they just didn't stand up to a lot of other bbq places in town. They gave us plastic utensils, not something i would expect when digging into meat. We all bought a Groupon, but didn't realize it was only good for 1 table/party, it was $7.50 for $12.

This has been the best bbq I've come across in Vegas! Everything I've ordered from the pulled pork to the ribs and tips have been amazing. All the sides are exactly as you'd remember your favorite Mac n cheese dish or your greens. Yams are perfectly sweet not too much liquid- no mallows. Sweet tea is always spot on sweetness.

And to think someone asked me to reconsider my trip to TC's and head over to Famous Dave's.  What a sucker.

TC's southern BBQ delivered especially at such an affordable price.  The offered  $10 for $20 deal was worth up, but keep in mind.. Their prices are super reasonable, so dessert would be in order to make this deal worth the while.

My beau and I ordered the Ribs, chicken wings, sweet potato fries and red beans and rice with cornbread on the side.  The Ribs fell off the bone as they should.  Delicious!  Ribs are typically the deciding factor for me when it comes to a BBQ joint winning.  They delivered!  Chicken wings were spicy and overcooked (per my request) perfectly.  Red Beans and Rice and Sweet Potato Fries weren't as tasty as anticipated, but I'm a picky southerner, so TC's probably didn't stand a chance before I even walked through the door in that arena.  The rice was a little under-cooked and tasted as if it came from a box.  The sweet potato fries were missing the whole sweet factor.  Just not great, albeit I gladly wolfed them down!

This place is very casual, small and made me feel like I was in DC/NOLA all over again.  I was there to get my greasy needs met, and they accomplished that and then some.  Also, the servings are decent, so I had some wings to go for a late night feast.  The service was nice as well.  However, I noticed they only had one server doing all the seating and serving, and even though it was quick for my visit, I would recommend a little patience.. she only has two hands, people.

Oh, and they had kool-aid!  Kool-aid!  I used to involuntarily drink that sugary mess in college due to lack of funds, so it was fun to drink some a few years later!  Maybe a wee bit too sugary to my liking.  I bet the kiddies would beg to differ.

Don't waste your money! $18.00 for pulled pork, mac n cheese, green beans, soda, and a 1.00 tip. Totally not worth it. first off the pulled pork was was like a gravy, the mac n cheese was okay but not great, and the green beans we're frozen. I will NOT go back.

After coming here twice I have found my new favorite rib crib. The place is small but the portions are huge. I got the 3 meat combo with all ribs (beef, baby back & spare) with coleslaw and potato salad as my sides. The beef ribs had good flavor but not a lot of meat. The baby back were fall of the bone delicious. The spare ribs were excellent as well. The coleslaw was buttermilk based and no vinegar it was the perfect compliment to the ribs. When I tried the potato salad I got a chunk of egg and potato it was perfect. I will definitely be back.

5/5 for BBQ. This Texas style bbq the way I remember it. 

Brisket comes shaved, not chopped, with a healthy dose of sweet and lightly spicy bbq sauce. I also loved the rib tips, as well as the pulled chicken, and everything we had was excellent. I'll  be back for sure.

So happy that I found this place!!! Got home late and definitely didn't feel like cooking and I just couldn't force myself to get up and go anywhere. Ordered delivery 20 min before they closed!!! Ordered the half chicken and the three meat combo (brisket, pulled pork rib tips) with Mac and cheese and green beans. Fed 2 people with left overs. Rib tips were fatty. I thought they were gross. Wasn't a fan of the pork or brisket. The chicken and sides were AMAZING!!  4 stars because I wasn't forced to order Chinese or Thai (which is one step up from cracking a can of soup and eating it cold) but if it wasn't for the delivery factor I would have given 2. Oh and I selected the "make it all white meat" option and was charged $2 extra on the chicken... But they delivered dark and white. I also tried to order the chicken without the all white meat option and I wasn't able to. Over all it's an amazing alternative to Chinese or Thai.

Always wanted to try this spot. Finally decided to after my daughters soccer game. Staff was fast and friendly. Got a two meat combo of baby back and brisket with corn bread and collard greens. The meat was delicious and tender. Pleasantly surprised. Great job guys. Oh wait. The collard greens were inedible. Tasted like someone dropped a bag of salt in my cup. It was overlooked since the ribs were so tasty.

After a disappointing pulled pork sandwich at another barbecue place -  Sassy Sal's in the Northwest- I was still craving the real thing so my girlfriend recommended we go to TC's which has been a favorite of hers for a while. 

We had a certificate from Restaurant.com which obliged us to eat there and while we were originally hoping for take-out, I'm glad we stayed.  First impression - I really liked the decor which had great, vibrant color along with tasteful framed photographs on the wall which made you feel right at home.  This is exactly what I want from a barbecue joint -clean, tasteful, casual, and homey.

Service was prompt, friendly and attentive throughout.  The food was the real deal - plenty of  great tasting pulled pork with just a bit of sauce on the bun and great coleslaw to go on top.  My girlfriend got a two meat combo with beef ribs, hot links, and two sides which she said was also good.  The peach cobbler was great - and I don't even like peaches!  I can't wait to try the glazed donut bread pudding.

I'm kicking myself that I've lived down the street from TC's for two years and this was only my first time there.  They've got a ton of lunch specials for only $4.99 and daily specials. 'll definitely be back soon.
I really enjoy eating here! The food is great the restaurant is home-y and the staff is pretty nice. Love the mac and cheese and the banana pudding!

We had gotten a groupon for this place so we decided to go check it out and see if we could maaaybe find   some good bbq.   We think of bbq as smoked meats... there weren't any smoke rings we could find on any of this meat...We each ordered the three meat combo, it came with two sides., and cornbread.   I chose the chicken breast, beef brisket and rib tips with cole slaw and onion rings.  My chicken tasted like it had been baked, slathered with sauce then left in the fridge for the last couple of days.  It was definately reheated and not fresh. The rib tips were char burned, not smoked.  My brisket was actually pretty tasty, but still not smoked.  There was nothing special about the coleslaw or the onion rings....My husband got the  rib tips, pulled chicken and pulled pork with potato salad and sweet potato fries.  The rib tips were all char burned, his  pulled chicken was dry and bland.   His pulled pork was pretty much the same.  Their potato salad was awfull, it had no good flavors, but lots of mushy potatoes and not enough sauce.  His sweet potato fries had good flavor but were way undercooked and soggy.  Their cornbread was too dry so we didn't eat it.  All in all this was very disappointing.  We had two waitresses, one was very good at her job, but the other gal litterally dropped stuff onto our table.  I dont think we'll be back.

The better bbq in Vegas. Now I've been to Famous Dave's (which sucks) and Buzz BBQ (it's ok) and TC's is one of the better joints. I ordered the family meal deal which you get your choice of 4 different meats, 3 sides, 1 fried side, and corn bread or white bread. My choices were:
1.) Brisket - covered in bbq sauce that wasn't too tart or too sweet
2.) Rib tips - tender and covered with the same sauce
3.) Pork links - sliced in half with nice char marks. A bit salty though.
4.) Baby back ribs - so tender you don't need a knife.
5.) Baked beans - I am not normally a fan of beans but I enjoy this. It's a great compliment to the greens
6. Greens - very salty but good when combined with the beans
7.) Mac n cheese - could be cheesier but i like how the flavors are a bit mellow since you have the strong flavors from the bbq
8.) Fried okra - love these little bits of goodness
Finally, 9.) Corn bread - it should really be called mini corn muffins. My only complaint with these is that it's way too small. I love me some corn muffins.

The staff is very friendly and very professional. The food is pretty on point with good flavors and tenderness. Overall, this is my go to place for bbq in Vegas. Now all I got to do is go there for their fish fry

We used a yelp deal $10 for $20. Its really a steal of a deal. The people who work here are all quite friendly. The Food is great. I mean, it really is delicious. Im a person that has high expectations and TC's meets it. This was our second visit and we enjoyed it. Its kept clean and there is ample space. I had the pulled chicken sandwich. First time having that and i enjoyed in thoroughly. Sweet tea, oh YUMMY!

Food is just alright spare ribs with the best thing the baby back ribs taste like that was burnt the rib tips was horrible mac and cheese bad green beans good cornbread didn't even taste like cornbread I bought a voucher from Yelp and I couldn't use it I don't think I'll be getting food from them again

Whenever I don't have time to smoke ribs, TC's is right down the street to get my fix.

So far, I've been getting full racks of beef and spare ribs. Both racks are delicious, but there is something special about beef ribs. I had cow rib meat all in the nooks and crannies of my teeth. I love that feeling! It's so soothing! You know you've been eating ribs when you smile and you got all this shit stuck in your grill. EYE LIKA!!!
Both full racks were big orders, but It seemed like you got a lot more with the full rack of pork spare ribs. The price isn't bad at all for a full rack. Solid ready-to-go bbq, although I wish they would drenched their ribs in bbq sauce. Make sure to ask for extra sauce. 

The Ribs will get you there if you're too lazy to make them yourself...

There still is a lot on the menu that needs to be sampled. Will update...

I ordered 2 full slabs of spareribs dinners and a rib tip dinner. I asked for extra bbq sauce and all of the dinners came with barely any sauce. I only got 7 ribs on each of the FULL slab dinners for 23.99 each! That is a rip off and I know a full slab has more than 7 ribs! I'll stick with Lucille's from now on. At least I get what I pay for!

I've been going to TCs since they opened and I tasted their pulled pork for the first time like 6 years ago or whenever it was. They have some good bbq and sides and pretty decent prices.  

The pulled pork is the main event here for me, although I confess during the whole span I've never tried the ribs. I was just never a huge fan of ribs in general. The brisket is well cooked and the links are nice and spicy. They have rib tips which I've had and they are very good and at 8.99 for a plate of them with 2 sides and cornbread, it's honestly almost too much to finish. They also have chicken and waffles, and their waffles are seriously good eats.  The sides are plentiful and they have different ones each day. I always get the fried cabbage when it's on the menu because its delicious, and the macNcheese is not bad either. The deserts are all homemade and the ones that I've tried are good. They had this oreo pie that is to die for, but the last few times I've visited it's not been there =(  Also theres kool aid on the drink menu, its like 1.50 or so for a giant cup with refills. Purple please. Oh yes.  

I've never had a problem with the service, though my visits are like 70% takeout, 30% dine in probably. The girls that work there are nice and the chef has come out to greet once or twice. It's very friendly and  inviting atmosphere in the dining room, so I would recommend at least one visit to see if you enjoy it as much as I do.

Southern-style side dishes are my ultimate comfort foods. TC's offers a nice assortment of them, and features daily specials. I ordered the mac and cheese, fried okra, and sweet potato tots. The mac wasn't creamy, but it sure was cheesy! The okra was also good. I really liked the slightly sweet and flavorful barbecue sauce that they brought out to the table. The Arnold Palmer (iced tea and lemonade) tasted just right.

TC's has an unbelievable deal for lunch specials on Tuesday, when 2 people can eat for $4.99. They have different specials each day of the week, but this one really stood out.

I was checking out the display case full of desserts up front by the cashier, contemplating a slice of coconut cake for later, when something else caught my eye. Glazed donut bread pudding? Are you kidding me? I should have listened to the cook, who told me to get two orders. He knew what he was talking about. There were bits of peach, plump raisins, and walnuts under the donuts, and the whole thing was topped with cream cheese frosting. It's crazy. I bet it goes well with a cup of coffee.

And tomorrow, I will go to the gym.

Wow this place is really good. Very clise to perfect and to top it off everyone there is so nice. Can't wait to come back and eat more of their ribs and mac n cheese. A must go I give it two thumbs up.

I was looking forward to eating here. Wow ordered a side of O rings and Jalapeno poppers received 5 - O rings and 5 - poppers  $ 3.85 each , that feels pricey 
 Half slab of baby back , it was a little cold,
Cold slaw was soggy over all spent $65.00 plus felt very let down
 Only good thing the waiter was VERY Professional.

Awesome! Gabby rocks!
Staff friendly and the food is down he cooking at its yummiest! 
Can't wait to try more!!!

The menu surprised me.  Much more of a soul food spot than a rib crib.  Had the world famous baby back ribs, collard greens (you have to ask for them, not on the menu), macaroni and cheese, and the baked beans.  All AMAZING!  Corn bread....not so much! Sweet tea was exactly what you think of when you picture sweet tea in your head.  Ordered the food and it was at the table within 8 minutes, hella quick! Super fresh.  Thanks TC, your rib crib made a great day that much more awesomer.  If you are reading this just go ahead and check them out

Spare ribs were as close to perfect as I have ever had. Meaty, fall-of-the-bone, beautifully smoked with just the right amount if fat. UmChicken also terrific. Some of the younger servers a little clueless, but oh a more experienced young lady straightened everything out. But who care? Oh  those ribs!

So... pretty gross... I got the rib tips special with two sides and cornbread for 11.99... They were mostly bone and fat... It was sad how much of my plate was left it looked as though they hadnt even been eaten. The sides i got were baked beans and candied yams. The beans were basically buschs canned beans. Nothing homemade about them. The yams were so saturated in the thick sweet honeylike paste that they were too sweet to even eat. They were also super overcooked so that made them really mushy. Overall... They get two stars for the bbq sauce and the pepsi. :/ wont be coming back.

Where do I begin thank you New Orlean flavors brought right here to Vegas. 
The ribs were a bit fatty, but the sauce was delicious. The BBQ chicken , cole slaw, cornbread were ALL good. To top it off the better than sex pie and buttermilk pie hit the spot without making you feel too guilty.

The one thing that needs work is the mac n' cheese! Definitely, don't appreciate the cheese combination.

The lunch specials are pretty good under ten bucks.

Be there three times in the past year one time I dine in super great service very attentive to my family second time I order to go like today the food is great a lot if meat on the full slab ...lol tasty .... but on to go orders sometime you get the whatever actitud. .... lol
I still a good deal ... on the Groupon  app
I travel from 215 n eastern. .. I love those ribs ....
The real deal in BBQ & soul food. Great ribs and brisket. Sides fantastic. Candied yams are spectacular and potato salad is the best. Can't go wrong.

Visiting from California and was told about TC's Rib Crib, was told we must try their  BBQ and fried fish. Let me just say everything we tried was delicious, even the corn bread! The service was excellent and the atmosphere was very friendly. We will definitely visit TCS Rib Crib again!

TC's specializes in down home cooking and Southern hospitality, and it definitely feels that way when you walk in.  The restaurant is comfortably decorated; I like the red tone to it.  And the menu is a simple size while still offering sufficient options.

The date and I each got our own 2 meat combo with 2 sides and cornbread.  I ordered the baby back ribs, beef brisket, mac and cheese, and Big Sam's baked beans.  Unfortunately, our meals came out sans cornbread, but we asked for it mid-meal and a piping hot paper tray of two pieces of cornbread (they were really muffins) came out.  No butter, not that I needed the calories, but it would've been a nice addition.  And they were just okay.

The baby back rib meat peeled off the bone easily with my fork.  The first bite made me nervous - it was dry.  I kept digging and the meat in the middle was moist.  I don't know what happened, but the moist rib meat was good.  The ribs tasted more steamed than BBQ'd though.  I was really craving a smokier flavor.

The beef brisket was good; it was tender and juicy.  It paired very well with their homemade BBQ sauce.

The mac and cheese and beans came out in styrofoam containers.  That made me nervous thinking that they store their premade sides in the containers and warm them up to order.  But, it did come in handy for taking the sides home since there were plenty of leftovers.  The cheese on the mac and cheese was clumpy and not melted into the normal smooth sauce I was expecting.  It was an odd consistency, but it tasted okay.  The beans were also okay.  Both benefited from a healthy shake of salt and pepper.

My favorite meat was actually the pork links that my date ordered.   They were perfectly salty and had a wonderful smokey char.  They were also beautifully grilled with lovely black grill marks.  I could've eaten just those and been happy all day.

In conclusion, it was okay, but unfortunately not the best BBQ in the valley.  Aside from the smokey flavor missing in some meats, we were also wondering where the BBQ smell was.  The restaurant and parking lot were both missing the potent and mouthwatering fragrance commonly associated with BBQ places.  This left us both to wondering where and how the meats were being prepared.

So after spending some time in Texas I got so unbelievably spoiled for amazing Bar B Q. Sadly I haven't found anything that has come close, until now.

TC's had great Spare Ribs and Mac & Cheese. Their beef brisket was good but, didnt blow me away. The place is a simply family owned style place that is unassuming and informal. I will definately come back here and be hungrier next time as the portions are big!

I was referred to TC's Rib Crib by a friend while I was on vacation in Vegas... loved every single minute in there!! I had the pulled chicken with greens and candied yams...amazing!! And for dessert, I had the best ever--Glazed doughnut bread pudding.. it was soooo good!! Everytime I'm in Vegas from here on out, I will definitely be stopping by TC's!!

Best I have had in Las Vegas.  I live about 1 mile away from tcs and have thought about going for a while.  Tonight I took the dive and was very glad I did.  Service was good and very knowledgeable people working there.  I will be back to try other things.  All I can speak on is the ribs right now but thAt will change.

The food was ok. My son ordered the child sliders. He was suppose to get 2, they only gave him one, saying they combined the meat to make one big one. This thing was so small it looked like a slider baby! My wife ordered a coffee, which was almost $3.00. When she was half way done, the waiter asked if she would like a refill. So I'm thinking good service.....When I got the bill, he charged us for 2 coffees. When I asked about it, I was told it was policy to charge for refills!! Ya right! I didn't pay it. I will never go there again. Stay away unless you want to be overcharged.

TC's baby back ribs are the best ribs period.

Their barbeque sauses are good to average but their ribs are all perfect.

Limited side dishes end up being mediocre supporting cast members to the stars.  The pulled pork, the brisket, the did I say ribs are the ultimate meat fest.

HORRIBLE COSTUMER SERVICE. The owners niece did not want to except our groupon because she said the family owned business is losing money. She did not care about losing customers that were using YeLP or Groupons. She is very rude and is a LIAR. After we ordered we were very misled after until we got the bill.The staff here is unbelievable, not in a good way. Spread the word.

Eh, they market themselves as "soul food bbq", and I have to disagree. The food wasn't nasty, but it was not great. It was just OK. I won't be going back here, and I won't be suggesting it to friends.

It's good, but not great. I was expecting more of a barbecue flavor right out of the grill, but it was more like oven cooked rib with a lot of barbecue sauce. The flavor is savoring and mouth watering. But it's not for me, because I'm expecting more of a smoked flavor It's a personal preference I guess. I gave it a three stars, because I feel it was over priced, even with the yelp coupon I still payed $17.00 plus the $10.00 I paid yelp. Its still worth trying if you have not tried it for yourself. Like I said its a personal preference. I might or might not come back it depends on my cravings.
They have Lousiana style bbq. I moved from mid-west where is famous for bbq, and I'd missed it. When I tried rib tip, I was soo happy with the taste. Also, mac n cheese was good.

We ordered delivery from here which is $9! The driver made us go outside and wait for him. The bbq baby back ribs were decent, the macaroni and cheese was disgusting the pasta was cooked too long and It was sticky and dry-ish? The green beans were ridiculously salty and the onion rings left a puddle of oil in its box. The hot links were pretty good though. Also for the price of everything they could of gave more food. Oh yeah and they forgot to give us our baked beans side.

Some of the best BBQ in town for a great price. Service is always great and it is true southern comfort food. I like to take out the 2 meat deal with spare ribs, pulled pork or a 1/4 chicken, Mac & cheese and greens. The corn bread muffins and BBQ sauce are both amazing and the meal is more than enough for two to share.

Me and my son both bought the 10-for-20 deal. We presented our deals to the nice young lady #1 that seated us and all seemed ok. After ordering and eating our food, a 2nd lady #2... that took our orders, said we could not both use the deal. 

 Now, I tried to explain that the deal says "one per person" and not "one per table" or any other variance. They brought the owner to my table and he explained that he would not take both deals in a single sitting and suggest we come back another day to use the other offer.

I explained that we could have sat at separate tables and it wouldn't have made a bit of difference. I argued my point but, to no avail.  

Anyways, came back the next day just to burn off the other offer and to be done with it...will not be coming back.  

P.S....the food was just ok. Not bad if you have the deal but, I wouldn't pay full price!
Sooooo good!! Meat tender, sauce is great, greens is great (and I only eat my momma greens). The fruit punch is so good too! AWESOME  place, I GO ABOUT twice a month now!

Had the three meat combo bbq chicken, pulled pork and brisket. Sides were Mac n cheese and onion rings. 
Food was delicious, chicken was juicy and fresh and the brisket was so tender! Onion rings were fantastic and the mac n cheese was piping hot!
Server was attentive and on point also.

Amazing Food! The best in BBQ in Vegas.  Quite a wonderful surprise.  We bought the Groupon with a desire for BBQ. We were totally surprised by the best kept secret in Vegas.  Good sized portions that are reasonably priced.  You only have to eat here once to be hooked.  The ribs fell off the bone, the chicken was tender and flavorful and the Mac and Cheese, was hands down , the best we've ever had the pleasure of being served. The phrase, "This would be my last meal", was used more than once.  Everything they put in front of use we ate. We are very hard to please. :-) oh and.. Kyle was super helpful ..  TC's is a must visit!!
Good stuff!

Okay, normally I wouldn't review a place after eating there only once but I can safely say I won't be returning.  Got carry out the other day: pulled chicken sandwich, brisket sandwich, fries and onion rings.  All of the meat was really poor quality (mmm....boiled gristle!) and the sides were terrible too.  The sauce wasn't anything to write home about.   If their ribs are outstanding, I'd never know, but if they're willing to call the stuff I ordered barbecue, then they are really missing the point.

Maybe I'm a barbecue snob, but it's really got to be smoked to be called barbecue, doesn't it?  I think the closest that the meat I was served got to being smoked was second-hand from the guy lighting his Marlboro out in front when I pulled out.

I'm absolutely perplexed why my experience differed so completely from those who reviewed this place positively, but I won't be returning to give it a second chance.

Its amazing how fast a place can go from 5 stars to 1 by providing poor customer service. I went in the very next day for a business lunch and was treated very poorly by the staff and took 45 minutes for two meals while we were one of only three tables. I asked to speak to the manager  (the owners wife) and she was too busy to chat it up with paying customers. I interrupted her "meeting" to ask her to pass my contact info to TC so I could discuss the poor service with him. It was very obvious to me that the employees were not happy when TC was gone. A completely different restaurant on this visit. I would not suggest visiting this establishment until they decide that consistent quality and service are vital. I waited a couple weeks for the phone call that never came!
very good ribs plus the banana pudding for desert

I really wanted to love this place because who doesn't love ribs? Unfortunately the customer service was dismal. I was picking up and order for home and there  was one woman who had long braids who was so rude and dismissive towards me. Excuse me for bothering your day lady. Because of this one woman it has left a bad taste in my mouth for this establishment I will not be returning.

I love TC's Rib Crib! 

I work in the area, and often frequent TC's for lunch. They have fantastic daily and lunch specials! 

I have now tried everything on the menu. I'd highly recommend the Rib Tips, Pulled Pork, and the quarter chicken. The Mac and Cheese is a very delicious side.

Every time I go to TCs I'm reminded of being in New Orleans. The service is very good, and their prices are awesome. 

I would highly recommend TC's BBQ over any restaurant on the Vegas Strip
Went back the next day it wasn't worth the wait..Rib tips were just fat..couldn't chew it away..most of it ended up in my napkin.  It was seasoned pretty well and sides were decent

TC's what happened?  Have been several of times.  Food is good but the service is the worst!!! My husband and son each ordered two meats with sides. I ordered a salad with shredded pork on top.  They received their meal and were half way done and I still did not receive my SALAD!  The waitress never came over to say anything or check on us.  I had to yell across the  restaurant to inquire about my salad.  When I asked she said "oh, he's making it now!"....very rude, I might add.  I told her that she can  just cancel my salad as my family was almost done with theirs.  I nibbled on my husbands greens and rib tips.  When the waitress finally brought over the check there were never any apologies on my salad, REALLY!!  I will never go there again!  You are suppose to offer a Groupon to get customers to keep coming, not scare them away...but maybe that is why we were treated like second class citizens!  Hopefully, their good food will keep them in business and the service will not run people away.

We went there for my Birthday.  Biggest mistake ever, totally disappointed.  I am from Seattle and our Barbecue quality is not the greatest.  I have also been to Kansas, Alabama, Texas, and Georgia where I have had fantastic Barbecue.
Who slices beef brisket thin like deli meat unless it has been put in the refriderator and cooled.  It was rubbery and tasteless. The sides were ok.  I went there do to a video showcasing thier food.  What a lie. I will not be back.

Ate there today. Had beef hot links, baby back ribs, mac n cheese, collard greens and cornbread. I was highly disappointed. The links were over cooked to the point that they were mushy. The ribs were also over cooked. Mac n cheese wasn't very flavorful. Greens and cornbread  were the only two things I enjoyed.

Yassssss.....My hubby and I were so happy to find a good rib place in our neighborhood. Sometimes you just need to have some comfort food and this is our new place. They have so much more than ribs. The cheeseburgers are fresh and meaty and the dessert selection is to die for! Hello glazed doughnut bread pudding! I highly recommend this place if you're int e mood for some true down-home cooking.

I have never tasted anything so awesome! I like to try something new from T.C.'s everytime i go there, just i can't believe how something so amazing can be in vegas and not have that much popularity or hype! the BBQ sauce is amazing! the mac & cheese is freaking delicious along with the sweet potato fries!

It's difficult to please 10 people for a staff meeting, TC's was able to accomplish this and satisfy everyone's wallet! Awesome food and customer service! We will definitely be ordering from here again!

New to vegas....wanted some BBQ ribs...i searched and searched....seems like bbq is something hard to come by out here in the dessert.    Finally I found some good reviews for TC Ribs.   So I drove out there for a to go order.

Took my order of full slab baby back ribs and mac and cheese and baked beans.   The sides were good, the baby back ribs were a bit disappointing for my taste.  There was a lot of fat on the ribs and they really didnt melt off the bones.

This place is below average. For spending $80 on food I could go to Lucille's which has better food. 
Coleslaw was bland
their brisket is not traditional brisket
Ribs were eh
Cornbread was gross
BBQ sauce was alright
Their Mac and cheese was good! I am definitely not going back...again not worth the money I spent...

This is southern barbeque at its best. Hurricane Katrina made the owner move to Las Vegas and that was good luck for Vegas.

I had the barbeque ribs and my husband had the pulled pork. We split an order of fried chicken wings. All were terrific. The corn bread is the best I've ever had. Cole slaw was excellent. The only thing not outstanding were the french fries; there was nothing wrong with them, but they were just O.K. Crinkle cut fries would be perfect.

We were there on a Friday night and the place was almost empty. What is wrong with the people of Vegas? Why is this place not crazy busy?! 

I am looking forward to my next trip to Las Vegas so I can eat at TC's Rib Crib again!

Everything was good. Good food, good customer service, reasonable prices. The owner was out and about greeting folks. And was more then happy to fulfill my request for a sunrise (Kool Aid with lemonade). The ribs, Mac and cheese, greens, and candy yams were delicious. Although we are from California. We will return when we are in town. Thank you.

Decided to check this place out since we were in the area and there was a yelp deal. 

The food was decent, nothing too special but it took forever for the server to bring our food and it wasn't hot when it arrived. After waiting forever we didnt' want to send it back to be reheated. The restaurant wasn't that busy either so the delay and luke warm food was a disappointment.

I believe in 2nd chances! Ordered the Barbecued Chicken for take-out. It was so dry I fed it to my dogs and ate the 3 day old Albertson's Barbecued Chicken in my fridge. You know it tasted fresher and better! Corn Muffins were good though.

I went there for catfish on a Friday. The website says one price then when you 
purchase your order, the price is different.  I was told they could not change the
prices on their website.  I would call this "False Advertising".

Love this place. Always come in here dying for their mac n cheese! There's this one guy at the place who shows exceeded customer service. He always checks up on us, is very nice, and serves the food with a smile! 
I personally love the beef brisket; it goes well with their BBQ sauce. My favorite, however, is the mac and cheese. Sometimes it comes out cold, but oddly, I like the mac and cheese cold because the cheesy taste pops more. I love this place I'll come back many times!

I read many of the reviews and with so many positives decided to try this resturant. We must have hit them on a bad day. We ordered a rack of baby back's and three sides. The sides were ok but the ribs were unacceptable. They were totally dried out and very tasteless and would have appeared to be hold overs. We ate a few and threw the majority in the trash. Being from the mid-west I know what good BBQ should taste like. Famous Dave's are far superior. Too bad there is not a Dickies locally. 

Again we may have caught them on a bad day but with the cost, delivery and tip I won't take another chance.

Great place.  Our favorite rib house. The ribs were meaty and tasty. 
Service was friendly and efficient. 
Like the new location and that its locally owned.

Ordered through Eat24. Wanted some ribs and we didn't feel like driving anywhere for it. Overall, not impressed.

The delivery time was good. Took a little over 30 minutes.

We ordered a full rack of beef ribs and a half chicken. The ribs had barely any meat on them at all. There were only a couple out of the whole rack that had a decent amount of meat. I feel like a paid almost $25 for a pile of bones with BBQ sauce on them.
The chicken failed as well. The meat was extremely dry and had tiny bones stuck in the meat.
On a positive note, the macaroni and fries were pretty good.

I won't order from here again. Next time, I'll just get off my ass and drive somewhere better.

There weren't too many people in here when I came to eat. I was looking for something good and looked on yelp for a place that was offering a deal. TC's ribs was it.

I had the chicken and waffles, which was okay but nothing special. The service was good, and the atmosphere was good as well.

The only issue I really had was that I could not claim my deal because there was a glitch in the yelp app that wasn't allowing me to upload my credit card and pay for the deal. The restaurant wouldn't let me get the deal if it wasn't through yelp, which kind of sucked. It's not their fault though so I'm not blaming them or taking any points away for that.

I still say for chicken and waffles to go to skinny fats or hash house.

Had a hankering for some rib tips and decided to give TCs a try. I had some ribs tips, greens, and okra. The rib tips were just ok. Some of the pieces were nothing but fat. The okra was pretty good and I've had better greens. Not sure if I came on a bad day but I'd be willing to give them another shot.
Awesome food and service. Had the beef ribs and they were great. Highly recommend this place if your in the mood for great barbecue and over the top service.

All the best intentions...

The brisket was loaded with gristle and slathered with barbecue sauce.  I may try the pulled pork next time - if there is a next time - since it's close to my office.  Nice 'soul food' kind of atmosphere.
We went with the Groupon deal. Everything was "okay"... (Atmosphere, food, service). Don't believe we'll ever go back.

Read about this place in a travel magazine and decided to take my employee to lunch here on his first day of work. My employee loves barbecue and had not been here. Since it's in a strip center, we knew what to expect as far as surroundings, but the ribs were dry and the sides were awful. The service was very good and they were very friendly. I recommend the iced tea.

Worst BBQ in Las Vegas I went ONLY because the 10 for 20.00 deal and wanted to call American Express and dispute the charge for this burnt excuse for meat!! I ordered the 3 meat special ribs brisket and rib tips which can break a tooth they are do burnt!! Do NOT waste your time go to the frozen section at smiths for better taste/quality
Good stuff. Def worth trying out.

I recently purchased a yelp deal for this place. My family and I used it for the fourth of July for bbq and had to return (to not waste the money spent) while we were still in Vegas to use the rest of the deal $$.

First, what kind of bbq restaurant doesn't smell like bbq when you come in?
This should have been a red flag and indication to run, but we still ordered and sure enough, the 'bbq" just was cooked meat (tried rib tips[extremly old and dry], whole chicken, chicken wings, and pulled chicken [found bones]) with bbq sauce on it.
The side dishes were terrible and lacked flavor. This place tried to have soul food, but it was greatly apparent that they really don't know how to cook, let alone make soul food.

Upon the return visit, we tried catfish and it was so terrible that I couldn't even finish one whole piece. The "catfish fillets" were obviously pre-battered and precooked (where the person in the back just dumped them in the oil) because there was a lack of seasoning, the pieces were cookie-cutter shape, and they were so dark from re-frying them.

The crazy thing is that some dude said that everything was fine.

If you want edible food- STAY AWAY!!

First time here and things were great. We got the spare ribs with green beans, onion rings, and fried pickles. Servings were good sized, not too excessive but enough we all got our fill. The only thing that wasn't a winner for me was the cornbread.  But the staff was nice and the take out was well packed and we got everything we ordered. We'll be back for sure.

Tonight we decided to order takeout from TC Ribs. The reviews on Yelp seemed promising and the pictures on Instagram looked great; however, we were not very satisfied with this purchase.  The meats were actually good.  I had pulled pork and brisket, very juicy and tender.  My boyfriend had ribs and chicken, which he also thought were flavorful and juicy.  The sides were very subpar.  The macaroni and cheese was dry and pretty bland.  We also did not care for the potato salad.  The greatest disappointment was that we ordered a side of catfish and were charged $12.99 for two very small fish fillets (basically the size of a chicken finger each).  This was only for the fish fillets, did not include any sides at all. TC ribs should be embarrassed to charge their customers this.  Additionally, the online menu stated the cost for my two meat combo was $15.99, yet I was charged $17.99 instead.  The cornbread was decent, but we were told in placing the order we would receive 3 pieces and there were only 2 packaged when we arrived home.  Finally, we were greatly disappointed in the desserts.  My chocolate cake had that refridgerator taste when something has been in refrigerater too long.  Also, my boyfriend is from Louisianna and Peach Cobbler is his absolute favorite desert, yet he only ate about 1/4 of it.. He is not one to complain, but this man never has any food leftover on his plate.  Thank God we were able to use the $10 for $20 Yelp deal, otherwise our bill was almost $70 for a very subpar meal.  Needless to say we will definitely not be dining here again.

I am not from Vegas, but we come to visit often to visit family and we always have a meal here. I look forward to it every time! The ribs are fall off the bone tasty. I like their wedge style french fries, and the coleslaw is delish. Baked beans are great and the pulled pork is really good. But those ribs... baby backs, I just can't get away from them.

very tasty meats. we tried the family combo and got everything but the chicken and beef ribs. can't say i was disappointed by any of the meats but the brisket was definitely the winner. only caveat is: don't order the collared greens unless you regularly eat handfuls of salt with your meals.

I love coming here to get the baby back ribs, pulled pork, collard greens, potato salad, corn bread, and fried okra.  The meat falls off the bone and is just easy to devour.  I had their chicken too and found the dark meat more desirable than the white meat.  To appreciate the white meat, I needed to dip in to the barbecue sauce, which by the way has a zing to it.  

The pulled pork sandwiches are also to die for.  I'm not normally a fan of pork, but I'll eat it here over other places that serve it.

Bought the 10$ for 20$ Yelp Special today as my boyfriend and I have been wanting to try TC's since we moved to the area. So, we went and tried it today.

We both got the meat and 2 sides + cornbread meal. He got the pulled pork, sweet potato fries, and mac. I got brisket, mac, and baked beans.

Our waitress was very nice and helpful. Our food looked awesome when it came out and we couldn't wait to dig in. The brisket was okay, I think I would have liked it better if I had ordered the sandwich. My boyfriend loved the pulled pork, and I have to say I did too, I kept eating from his plate! The mac was funky. We both didn't like the texture of the sauce, I prefer my mac and cheese to be creamy and this was kind of gritty. Sweet potato fries were good, and so were the baked beans. 

I didn't get to try any dessert, I was too full :( Overall this place is okay. Nice, chill atmosphere. I'm definitely going back for that pulled pork in the future, and I have to try their ribs to make my complete decision.

Really, really excellent!
The only reasons I'm giving 4 stars instead of five is because the BBQ sauce on the brisket was a little too much and a little too sweet (it was served that way).
Other than that the ribs were amazing, the mac and cheese was wonderful, the beans were really good and they had a $1.00 peach cobbler that was incredible!!
I went in a little hesitant because of some of the negative reviews, but we had a really grand experience!!
I WOULD recommend it, and I WILL return!!

3rd stop on the BBQ tour.  Not sure why i haven't seen  this place  before considering i've eaten at the sushi place in the same strip center 2 times.

very simple looking place but comfortable.  Appears to be a family run place - i like that.  ordered the spare ribs w/ cole slaw - $7.

I give TC the cole slaw edge - but just a slim edge.  

The ribs - my guess, they boil first then grill them - the ribs were soggy.  They get props for the bbq sauce - nice bite, flavor.  but the ribs bothered me.

still i gotta hit this place again for the family mac and cheese and potato salad I also need to try the  pulled pork.
really good food. we haven't dined inside yet, but they're really quick with "to go" orders. Calling ahead helps too.

This was the second time I've been to TC's. 

The first time I had the 3 meat combo (Brisket, Rib Tips and Baby Backs, none of these were enjoyable, sorry) with 2 sides (mac n' cheese which was very dry and Cole Slaw very enjoyable). The cornbread was good.  

I saw the Yelp gift certificate ($20 for $10) and decided to give it another try. 

This time I had the Beef Ribs (very tasty but a lot of FAT and small amount of meat) and the Spare Ribs (this by far has been the best of the meats so far. I went ala carte as I wanted to try the Peach Cobbler.  I'm so glad I saved room this cobbler was delish.  I would say a lot of time was put into making it.  Great flavor! I asked them to bring it to me cold not heated and that they did.  With the scoop of vanilla ice cream, I was in heaven!

I believe this is a family owned and run business, started by father and now run by the son. The server I had on my second visit, James, was one of the friendliest and personable I have ever had for a small place. His smile and his truly caring attitude was ever present.  He wanted me to have a good meal!

All-in-all, I've rated TC's with three stars mostly based on the service, though I did like the cobbler  :) .   As for rating TC's for their Ribs, well that would be a thumbs down at this point.  Will I go back, yes I'll give them one more try if only for the service, but I'd hope that the ribs will be better the next time..

Really wanted this place to be a winner. 
We tried this place twice before- this is our 3rd time. Never wrote reviews b/c we hoped we were just experiencing one of their "off days". 
Reason for my rating : Too inconsistent and doesn't taste like "Soul" food. 

We ordered a Full Slab of ribs twice - received 7- 8 ribs both times. For those that know about ribs, know how many is a slab... Not sure what they're doing but either way I should AT LEAST get 10 ribs... Don't just completely insult my intelligence!

The ribs are either tender and meaty on some days or fatty and chewy on others. I don't like the inconsistency. 

Um next, the corn bread- it cries for milk and sugar -tastes like airy cornmeal and water...

Potato salad- The first time was pretty good- which is why we ordered it for the 2nd time but it was too chunky. Then ordered again for a 3rd time just to make sure the 2nd time wasn't a mistake and it again was too chunky. I'm talking too chunky like I had to chop 1 piece of a potato into 3 smaller pieces. 
Which one is it, chunky or nah?

The Mac and cheese tasted like like a doctored up box of Velvetta Mac and cheese. 

Again this food is classified under "Soul Food".

Maybe sell grilled steaks and burgers and become an all American restaurant b/c your sides aren't good. You can't call it Soul Food just because you sell Mac and cheese, collards greens and corn bread. Soul Food is apart of culture just like Mediterranean or Asian cuisine.  Soul Food might be the wrong category for this one or at least my soul thinks so
Used the Yelp deal and I'm glad we didn't pay full price. Service is bad and they weren't busy! Don't have to return

pulled pork was pretty good...the same for the onion rings and okra but they tasted like they were from frozen...they were still good so what ever...the people working there seemed like they wanted to be outgoing and friendly but Im sick right now and I was in one of my anti-social moods so as they were being very friendly I probably came off to be a b*tch! (sorry for that)...price wise they are a little pricey and I agree with others that for the price vs. quality you could go somewhere else but the are so close to my house I dont mind paying. I could say they are a-ok but I will return again so I guess that makes me a fan!

Love the BBQ here. Really great tender juicy meat. The service is great. Real "Home" feeling when I eat here. Just great service. So polite. But the food speaks for itself. Cant find too many places in town to really have great BBQ. They have daily deserts made that are to die for. Try the "Better Than Sex" cake. Trust me. LoL. It jut might be. Jkjk. But yeah... Anytime your in town. Its worth the 10 minute trip from the strip to here.
Not sure why Las Vegas struggles to have good BBQ. This place is highly overrated. The ribs are par-boiled and the food is mediocre.

Love Love LOVE the sweet potato fries. Thank goodness for TC or I'd be more depressed in Vegas! The ribs are good. Not the best I've tasted, but it's good. Not recommend the Beef ribs though. The fibers of the meat is to tough for me and the size just too big. The portion is big for one, maybe barely enough for 2 if you don't order side dishes. I have yet to try the baby back ribs. I always order the sauce on the side, just so the flavor of the meat won't get masked by the sauce. The ribs are good for the leanness and not too fatty. Very tricky because it can be tough when the you're grilling meat with less fat! For the price it's a good neighborhood eatery that I would go to.

The staff was friendly, the food was great and the place was clean. We came late on a Saturday night and there were only a few people and were afraid we might get something warmed over but the dinner was hot and fresh!
We read about this when visiting Vegas and I guess the best I can say is we will make it a point to eat here te next time we are in town!

The place is a little small but the decor and furnishing have a welcoming feeling...of a family owned business that is actually relaxing.  Casual place, but nice! The food comes in good amount packed with flavor to savor as the aroma engulfs your smell senses. Prices are reasonable and portions are generous as far as meats go.  They could give a little more when it comes to sides though.   The servers at the time were very friendly, polite and helpful.  Food is generally of the South type flavor, but there is something everyone will love.  Especially the BBQ!  I haven't had a chance to try much of their other stuff...but I definitely will come back!
If you like brisket to taste like good ole refrigeration happy eating!  Otherwise run and dont look back?

Let me start out by saying that the staff is the best. They were nice and pleasant. I needed to have my lunch ready at open and they were happy to accommodate that. 

I ordered the Jr brisket Sammie lunch with fries. The fries are well seasoned and super yummy! I got my brisket sliced and it's super tender and full of flavor. 

I couldn't come here without trying the Mac and cheese. I'm a huge Mac and cheese snob, my grandma made the best, and this stuff is (sorry grandma) even better! Creamy and cheesy but not swimming in sauce. 

Do yourself a favor and come try them!

Side Note: I wish yelp's ordering app Eat24 had an option to add a side of cornbread it looks so good but wasn't on there to order!

My parents and I dined here on Thanksgiving eve, we were totally impressed with the quality and taste of the food.
The staff was very nice and checked on us to make sure we were satisfied with our dinner.
The baby back ribs were very tender and moist, the mac and cheese was GREAT, as were the sweet potato fries that my mom had.
I just wish they had coke products...
Not a fancy place but who wants to eat MESSY ribs in a fancy place!!!!
When I'm back in town I will for sure go back!
TRY IT,  YOU WILL LIKE IT!!!!!!!!

BEST FOOD EVER!  This is our second time here and we love almost everything on the menu! Brisket is fabulous, beef brisket is on point, BBQ Chicken is Out of this World GOOD! My son loves the pulled pork and says it's unbelievable! 

The sides are great too. I love the okra, greens & candied yams. My husband loves the potato salad and the beans! My son gets Mac & Cheese and fries...YUM!

This is everything you come to expect for a home cooked meal that touches your SOUL!

We will be back again & again!  I can't believe we just found this place after living in Vegas for 9 years already, so mad at that!!

This was an interesting experience. I wasn't sure what to expect when I walked in. There are photos everywhere and a cluttered entrance. We sat down and took forever to get drinks. Waitress took our order and then another waitress came by as our waitress must have been new and didn't know what we wanted. I was thinking it was going to all come out wrong. The food came and WHOA! The best brisket I have found in Vegas! The sweet potatoes were perfect, the ribs fell right off the bone in tenderness. Mac and cheese was boring and dry, hoping grandmas Mac will improve. The manager came by and suggested dessert, which we took home after being so full. It hit the spot later that night! Food is absolutely worth the strange atmosphere and ambiance. The team was hospitable and fun, just keep training your newbie so next time will be a little more seamless.

Every time I stop at TC's I am reminded how great and friendly their staff is.  Even if I didn't love the beef ribs, I'd go back time and again.  Do yourself a favor and stop for lunch (or dinner) and be reminded what a great family dining establishment is all about!

Never got a chance to try the food , we waited 45 minutes and it still never came. Waitress never came to our table to refill drinks or say the food will be out soon. We got up and left they didnt say they were sorry and even had to pay for my soda. Its ok though the prices were very high too high to have to eat off of paper plates & plastic forks. Will never go back.

If you are a fan of pulled pork or mac n cheese that probably has 10,000 calories in it then this is the spot for you.....and me! OMG, I found this place years ago and have actually celebrated a birthday or two, here. It's absolutely charming in every way. TC's is a hole in the wall decorated like your grandma's house with family pictures, place mats and friendly faces. If you are lucky you just might get to meet TC while you are here! I always get the pulled pork because it never let's me down. It's tender, juicy and shredded to the perfect consistency. You are responsible for putting the amount of BBQ sauce you like on your meat. I also always get the mac n cheese that is to die for. Don't leave out the fried okra, ribs, grilled chicken salad, sweet potato fries, etc. You can wash it all down with sweet tea or Kool Aide. Dessert is not to be missed. At the top of that list is the banana pudding and glazed donut bread pudding. Yes, that just happened! Every single person I have brought to TC's has been back and brought their friends, too! They get the five stars because they are reasonably priced, delicious food, and most excellent service. I love this place!!!!!

My guilty pleasure. I call up this joint when I'm in some dire need of comfort food and it always hits the spot. I believe the mixed reviews have alot to do with the inconsistency in freshness that I've sometimes experienced here myself. I think the time of day and week you happen to order or dine in has alot to do with it here, as it can be hit or miss in that department. I have ordered when the food was hot off the grill and the meat was melting off the bones. I've also ordered when the ribs were not just made and the sides definitely appeared to be reheated. There is a huge difference but chalked it up to coming during a rather vacant time of day. This is a small family business and I think if you are smart about when you order or arrive during a fairly busy time, you will get your food alot fresher. I order around dinner time closer to weekends when there's a line out the door and I'm never disappointed. I recommend the spare ribs, mac n cheese and potato salad is good. I wasn't too impressed with the cakes I've tried but I'll try the pudding next.

You know, it was terrible? Ok, yeah, it was not what I was hoping for. I don't think I would go back. I bought the Groupon, so I was kind of on the hook for $20. Unfortunately, I should have read the YELP reviews before I went. the meat was smothered in sauce and very greasy. Not the best at all. There are plenty of other options in Vegas for BBQ. Try them.

I'm a big fan of good ribs and this place fell short of good ribs. The price wasn't bad because of the $10 for $20 coupon I bought on Yelp but they quality just wasn't there. The ribs weren't tender and a little cold I used extra bbq sauce cause the taste of the ribs wasn't very good. I do want to say the service was good though.

Here are some suggestions for this establishment. (T.C. S Rib Crib
The first is to replace the front door mat. It's to shreds and 10 bucks would replace it creating a far better first impression. When I saw this I was reluctant to walk in.
Clean the windows and door daily. Dirty door dirty food?
Have staff wear clean uniforms. Residue on aprons is not appetizing.
Food is mediocre, but who can get past the above mentioned items?
Get it together T.C.s!

Really simple and good eating.

Just grab a slab or half if you're not that hungry and grind away.  The ribs are excellent.  Very moist, super tender and while the sauce may be a personal thing, to me, its incredible.  Sticky, sweet, sour.  (No, I'm not trying to cause a food war.)

Prices are really good.  A full rack for less than $20.  For just two bucks more, you can add two sides and cornbread to your ribs.

Other items are also good but really, why would you not want the ribs.

Oh yeah, Friday is catfish fry day.  Give the fish a try (as a side to your ribs)!

Great to dine in with the family, or get take out when the kids can't handle a sit down meal! ;) I love the friendly, cozy atmosphere and the staff is so genuinely nice! We've been here several times and are never disappointed!

This was our first experience withTC and it'll be our last. We had carry out and tried a number of items. The barbecue sauce was highly rated- tangy, sweet and flavorful. The ribs  and chicken wings were cooked nicely. The cole slaw was good as well.  No complaints there. The problems were with the following:

Cornbread: very odd, off-tasting, bland, giving the experience of eating a gummy lump of flavorless dough. I wanted to like it but there wasn't anything to go on. 

Catfish: fried nicely, but tasted like thawed out store fish. Overloaded with salt.

Macaroni and cheese: bland, flavorless. We guessed all the salt was used on the fish. 

French fries- tasted like the frozen potatoes we imagine they started as. Easily became cardboard-like. No flavor. 

Peach cobbler: by far the most disappointing. The only sweetness came from the peaches. The dough was just gloppy and flavorless. Where was the sugar? The vanilla? 

Our meal felt like a series of memory lapses where seasonings were forgotten. This sounds like a one-star review but I added a star because we enjoyed the BBQ ribs and chicken. When you spend money you want EVERYthing to taste good!
The pulled pork and bbq chicken was yummy. The sweet potato pie was a disappointment, tasted more like a lemon bar

The best BBQ in Las Vegas!  I can see why this place is so popular.  My 1/2 BBQ chicken with mashed potatoes, mac & cheese and corn bread was outstanding!   The bbq sauce is sooo good, too!  My waitress,  Reshea, was so nice and provided excellent customer service. Everyone there was really cool and was such just a really nice dining experience. I highly recommend this place to anyone that loves really great BBQ. 5 Stars!

It's not the food. It's the attitude of the staff. Small businesses depend on neighborhood clienteles. Tc ribs do not act like a small business that appreciates their customers. It's a shame that I won't ever come back because they have lost my loyalty due to poor customer service.

**Summary**
       - Ribs - The spare ribs were probably one of the best ribs I've ever had. The meat inside was just so tender. The bbq sauce was just perfect with fire-kissed crust.
       - Homemade - Almost all of their non-fried sides are homemade. It gives the food a more family feeling.
       - Location - They used to be over on Dessert Inn but moved to a roomier location. They also changed their phone number and didn't update yelp until recently.
       - Price - The prices are a bit steep if you're eating for one. I usually share a three meat combo, so it ends up being about $9 a person. Trust me when I say, it's a lot of food.
       - Consistency - It seems people either really like or really hate the place. Even something like the meatiness of the ribs is up for debate. I don't know if it's a consistency problem.
**Ordered**
       - $17.99 Three Meat Combo with 2 sides and cornbread muffins.
          - 1/4 Rack (3 bones) Baby Back Ribs (Pork) - Fire-smoked and crispy on the outside with their homemade bbq sauce. Meaty and juicy on the inside. It's a step above your overcooked Tony Roma's or Famous Dave's ribs.
          - 1/4 Rack (3 bones) Spare Ribs (Pork) - I'd prefer the spare ribs over the baby back because they had more meat and were thicker. This meant there was a lot more fall off the bone meat between the smoked crispy crust and the bone.
          - Beef Brisket - The bbq sauce, though the same as the ribs, just seemed too sweet. The brisket was not thick sliced like I was use to. It was thinly sliced like bulgogi. I probably wouldn't get this again.
          - Candied Yams - Homemade and caramelized to perfection.
          - Wedge Cut Fries - Crispy on the outside, cooked just right on the inside.
          - Cornbread muffins - Also homemade, they were sweet and delicious. For an extra dose of diabetes, you can add honey on top.
**Recommendations**
       - I'd recommend this place if you're looking for some calorific soul food. I'd choose your meats/sides wisely however. Reading the other reviews and my own experience, the items are either really good or really bad.

Always feels like I am away from Vegas!! The staff is always friendly, personable, and super nice. There was a large group here before my husband and I came in but they still made us feel like we were the only ones there with their attentiveness!! I love coming here, the food and staff always makes me feel welcomed!! Thank you TC's Ribs!!! I will be a returning customer!!
Food was really good. They accepted the YELP discount without question. I will definately go back.
Amazing baby back ribs...the sauce is just the right amount of sweet and spicy. Make sure to get the mac n cheese, it's the best I've ever had at a restaurant!

LOVE AT FIRST BITE... or so I thought.

A friend of mine keeps raving about how great this place is and how he would only get his BBQ fix in Vegas, and me being on my mission to find a BBQ joint I love, HAD to try this place.

It wasn't hard to find, which was good. It is a small place, with about 5 tables along one side and a larger table right in front and 2 tables outside. The service was great. The girls there was very nice and made sure we were taken care of.

The sides all seemed so good I wanted to try everything! But I didn't want to go overboard. Just figured if I liked it, I can always come back and try more. So me and my bf ordered a full slab of ribs (baby back) in the combo with mac n cheese and fried okra as our sides. They had waffled sweet potato fries that day and best believe I got that too!! (pictures posted). I was ready to wait the 20+ minute for the food as the sign said, but the food came out surprisingly quick! Though, not all at once.

So... the mac and cheese was great! Tasted very homemade and slightly gritty like they used ricotta cheese in it. Not as rich and creamy as I am used to, but the bf loved it. I really liked the fried okra, though the bf didn't care for that. But you can't go wrong with sweet potato fries, especially waffled! Yum! Very crisp but not greasy.

The cornbread was a bit disappointing. It came out a bit after the other stuff so I figured it was just being baked or something, but it didn't seem that way. It was somewhat dry and bland. Sadly, I really like the cornbread from Famous Daves! And the ribs, it was good flavor. And not overly saucy. But a bit dry. The first bite of the ribs were great..! But maybe they cooled quickly and became really dry that I didn't want to have more (like I usualy do).

Overall, the sides were great but the ribs were not the best, though not bad. I wanted to try the dessert, but didn't yet. Service was great. The place was clean. Gotta try the pulled pork and desserts next time! I will be back!

Me & the wifey went to the place 2 times the 4th of July weekend I can say the staff and owner are on point and very professional I recommend this place to all who love good food. Thanks Sam & Staff!!!!!
First time trying their bbq. I got the baby back ribs and Mac and cheese for my side and I was delicious!!

TC's came highly recommended as the BEST VEGAS BBQ. That's a tough one to live up to, especially having eaten great BBQ in Bham, AL. In spite of the challenge,  it turned out to be TERRIFIC! Friendly folks, good  service and terrific food, especially the baby backs anf the BETTER THAN SEX cake. Try this place when you want BBQ in Vegas. You won't be disappointed!

Tried this place for takeout once and deemed it was not half bad. Dined in the restaurant tonight and this is my take:

The restaurant atmosphere was simple, clean, and very relaxed. Almost like an order-at-the-counter-then-seat-yourself kind of place. There was indeed table service albeit not the friendliest, but also not bad. BF and I decided to share the full rack of baby backs plus two sides: beans and potato salad. Everything came out in speedy time (there were maybe 3 other tables of people) and was warm, but let me tell you, this is not a place that concerns themselves with presentation. Everything was served in single use paper or plastic containers - the sides even had lids on them! Not a big deal but almost made me wonder, "What did we get ourselves into?". Aesthetics aside everything was good. I thought the potato salad was a nice consistency and balanced, very complimentary to the BBQ. The beans were basic and enjoyable. The ribs came out barely wet but extra sauce was offered immediately. Once sauced up to my liking we dug in and were very pleased. Great taste, extremely meaty, and very tender. My only complaint is that there are little bits of bone and gristle to be picked out but that's sort of expected in place like this. The cornbread that came with the meal left much to be desired which is kind of surprising for a rib place. Overall, for the price we paid we were well-fed and our rib craving was satisfied. We even took about half the rack home. Would definitely return and recommend this place to friends. 

TIP: we used the Yelp $10 for $20 so we only ended up paying $6 (plus tip). There were tons of specials listed, too, like 2 for 1 Tuesday lunches so that makes this place even more of a bargain.

I'd just like to say that I've had bbq in Tennesse, Texas, South Carolina, Alabama and even NYC but I have NEVER had BBQ this tasty and tender
EVER!!!! 

I'm from the Tri-State, where there are some of the best spots to eat are in the world. I travel alot as well and I haven't been this impressed in a long time with BBQ. I'm a foodie and I was blown away with the food period!

We were on our annual Vegas trip and I went to look for the spot because of the reviews and I was tired of the same ole same ole on the strip.

TC's is Vegas's diamond in the ruff!!! The mac and cheese is so delicious I had to order another to go. They give you enough food that you can eat for days.  The chef came out to great us because I raved so much. The service is excellent too.

PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE go and check this spot out. It's affordable and I PROMISE you won't be disappointed. I can't wait to go back!!

This is some good bbq!!! The meat just falls off the bones on the spare ribs. The Mac n' cheese is sooo delicious, when you pull your fork out you have a string on cheddar hanging down.  Nice home cooked food. Pulled pork so good!!! If I had to not pick I'd say they need to get with a local baker for the bread. The bun for the pulled pork was blah. A nice big fluffy roll would have taken it over the top. Loved the hot links and bbq sauce.  Sharon is a sweet heart! This is a family owned mom and pop hidden gem! Great place to stop in for lunch while your dog gets washed next door.
Threw away my leftovers.  Sauce was just weird tasting.  Ribs were very tough.  Even the lady behind the counter was extremely rude.  Disappointing in every way.
Excellent service, excellent food. Loved the baby back ribs and pulled pork. Highly recommend!
The place is nice and the people are friendly but I don't like my food to be warmed up from the can. So no to baked beans at this place.

My friend and I stumbled on this place while we were looking for a Chinese buffet . We gave up and just wanted to eat so we came here. I wasn't in the mood for BBQ so I was just going to get a cheeseburger and fries. Then my friend noticed a sign behind me saying they have Chicken and Waffles on Wednesdays. We were there on a Saturday so we didn't know if they would serve it . We asked and we received!
