It's the kind of bbq that your uncle cooks at the family picnic. Nothing exceptionally spectacular, just pretty good bbq. It's obviously not going to win any Food Network World Champion BBQ competitions, but it was cooked well (the pork on my ribs literally just slipped off the bone) and has good sauce. 

The sides were also good. I got the mac and cheese and greens, which were far superior to what I was served at M&M's. The mac and cheese was perfectly seasoned (I only added a little bit of pepper, which I do to everything as almost a tick), and the greens were the perfect mix of sweet and salty. Most meals also come with a cornbread muffin, which was ok. I personally prefer slices of white bread with my bbq, so I'll consider asking for that next time I come. They also have all the best soul food drinks (Kool-Aid, Sweet Tea, Muddy Water), and come in a massive cup for like $2. My red Kool-Aid was literally served to me in the biggest cup I have ever received.

The atmosphere was typical of soul food restaurant: family photos on the wall, R&B music playing, those slippery booths they also have at Subways. The dinnerware were those hard plastic ones, and the utensils were disposable plastic ones. I wasn't mildly surprised by any of this, because, once again this was typical of SOUL FOOD BBQ restaurant. I've been to bbq restaurants that literally have three tables, and give your your food in Styrofoam containers regardless of whether you're taking it to go. 

The only thing that I found a bit unfavorable was that I thought it was a bit pricey for what your got. My 1/4 rib meal cost $11, and only came with one side (I split the other with my friend). That being said, I rarely leave a Vegas restaurant under $10, so I wasn't too surprised. 

All in all, TC's Rib Crib is pretty good soul food bbq spot, and I'll definitely be back.

i love TCs! best macaroni and cheese i have ever had. collard greens are flavorful, BBQ is succulent, and banana pudding is to die for!

the place itself has a real mom and pop family oriented feel. yelp had a $10 for $20 coupon and i definitely took advantage of that to purchase bucket loads of their mac and cheese for last years Thanksgiving. My family loved it. Check out their website for daily deals too. On tuesday they have 2 for 1 meals. i wish i lived closer to this place.

Came here on T. C. 's 76th birthday  so we had good carrot cake & chocolate cake for dessert after our meal of 1/2 all white BBQ chix with 2 sides ($11.99) & 2 meat combo  beef brisket & pulled pork with 2 sides fried okra & mac n cheese ($14.99).  Our server Mona was so good & personable.  We also won the raffle they had which was a prize of a $10 gift cert & a white T.C.'s Rib Crib Tshirt (the server's are in black Tshirts)
Now that's BBQ!!!! Took one bite and I already knew what the rest would be like.. Tender.. Juicy.. And FLAVOR!! Great work guys..

We have heard good things about the ribs so we tried it this past weekend the staff were all friendly. I had the pulled pork with sweet potato fries. The pork was good but the fries were over done. My husband had the ribs which also were good but his onion rings were to done. The dinner ware was plastic which just was a turn off.

I enjoy southern cooking, so I stopped in at TC's Rib Crib to try their beef ribs. I have to say that the beef ribs were disappointing. There was not much meat on them. They decently do not come close to Lucille's beef ribs. The catfish was excellent though. I will definitely be back for the catfish.
I've travelled all over the south and Texas. This is the best BBQ there is. Service is great. Get the desserts, the donut bread pudding is amazing.

Ordered for delivery and what a great experience!!!!!!
Food arrived timely and piping hot........
Spare ribs, brisket, hot links, greens and mac and cheese!!!!!
Meat tender and full of flavor!!!
Sides are like grandma use to make......
Will recommend to many!!!

Everytime I pass by I always see a sign for $4.99 lunch specials but when I look at the time it's either to early or to late. I always slow down looking at the sign as if it would magically change. $4.99 has to be a really good deal for BBQ so to save some bucks I wanted to go during lunch. Passed by on a Saturday, like clock work I see the sign, slow down, read the sign, and check the clock.  Almost continued on as usually but it was lunch time so turned at the next chance.  

"Yea Im gonna get my BBQ ON!!" Not so, no lunch special on Sat and Sun but a 2 for 1 breakfast special which was OK but I really wanted some BBQ.  Not much of a BBQ menu for breakfast, mostly omelets and waffles. Ordered the brisket omelet not my favorite I was expecting it to be covered with BBQ sauce and big chunks of brisket pieces instead there was tiny slices of brisket and not a lot of taste.  All there was on the table was hot sauce and ketchup. It was plenty filling though. Next time I'll see if they can give me some BBQ sauce.

I ordered some BBQ to go. Some of their "world famous" BBQ ribs which tasted really good and the meat fall off the bone tender like it suppose to.  The full slab was $20 but had a $10 for $20 yelp coupon so scored.

I had the craving for some brisket, hence the brisket omelet, so ordered that to. Again I was expecting thick pieces of brisket, you know something you can cut with fork.  Instead very thin slices kind of how you would eat deli meats.  It was also rubbery and chewy, not a fan of the meat but loved the sauce.

Services was good, friendly and warm must have been the holiday season.  The place was decked out for the holidays, stocking hanging, xmas tree, and music playing.  It was slow there so I don't think they mined me stay there a just relaxing after I ate.  Even stole a few ribs and brisket pieces out of my containers before I left LOL. They have dessert but I had no room, menu say to ask for their $1.00 dessert of the day.  I'll probably be back for more ribs and to try more of their BBQ menu. I like all of the old photo all over the wall.

The beef ribs! Never eaten at TC's but we had TC's make some beef ribs to come home. The beef ribs were a hit with my family. The sauce was so good, it made you wanna smack your mamma! Besides the sauce, the beef was tender. My only gripe was the lack of beef on the rib, it wasnt love at first sight but once eaten that all changed. Other than that the ribs were really good.
Great mac and cheese to go with my fried chicken. I usually burn my fingers trying to eat the chicken because I don't wanna wait. It's that good to me. It's worth it!

I must make this clear. This isn't a review of the food, which is wonderful, but of the TERRIBLE service that my Dad and I experienced today.

We were both in the mood for BBQ, and having been to TC's before at the old location, we decided to check out the new place. We walked in and were greated by the waitress on duty, a young Asian woman, who promptly seated us and gave us menus. There was only one other group of people in the room, which was surprising. We sat there looking at the menu for about 10 minutes, and then she finally took our drink order. After that, she dissapeared. Another 10 minutes walked by and we got up to leave. We crossed paths with her as we were walking out and she asked if we were leaving as she had the drinks we had ordered 15 minutes prior in her hands. We said yes, and she just said, "Okay," and dumped the drinks out in the sink.

This girl has to be one of the worst waitresses I have ever experienced. She obviously doesn't care at all about service, and I'm pretty sure the owners of the restaurant would be a little miffed at her for the waste of the drinks. 

I almost wish TC's had stayed at the old location, as it had much more of a family-oriented vibe to it...much more intimate. I'm going to give TC's another shot sometime in the future, but I think I'll call in the order and pick it up rather than face this sort of service again.

IF YOU SEE THE YOUNG ASIAN WAITRESS BEHIND THE COUNTER WHEN YOU WALK IN, YOU MAY AS WELL JUST TURN AROUND AND WALK OUT. Unless you want to be ignored for a good 30 minutes, that is.

This is painful. We've been coming here since shortly after the folks running TC's Rib Crib escaped hurricane Katrina. We bragged about them and sent our friends. 
I can no longer recommend this place. We spent $30 on beef ribs that were way too fatty, probably boiled first, the greens were bitter and stringy. 
These people used to win awards. I don't know what happened but, the lost they touch.

Heads Up, this place has moved to behind the O'Leary's Pub on Durango just south of Spring Mountain. 

Anyways, this place makes great food. I agree with other reviewers that it isn't as great as what you'd find in Texas but this is vegas not Texas so for the area their food is great.

If you want to have your socks knocked off then try their banana pudding. It's my favorite thing about this place.
